articles.title: DPRK Agricultural Workers Meet Members of Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK Agricultural Workers Meet Members of Chinese Delegation
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers in the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Co-op Farm, Sunan District, Pyongyang, held a meeting with the members of the delegation of the Agricultural and Forestry Workers Union of China on Tuesday.
					Present there were Vice-Chairman Kil Sang Bong and officials of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers, officials and farmers of the farm and members of the Chinese delegation led by Wang Junwei, vice-president of the National Committee of the Agricultural and Forestry Workers Union.
					
					Prior to the meeting, the participants toured a house visited by President Kim Il Sung and Premier Zhou Enlai, the DPRK-China friendship room, kindergarten, etc.
					
					They talked about achieving successes in the agricultural production this year and further developing the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Congratulations to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Egyptian President
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Muhammad Muhammad Morsi Isa Al Ayat   upon his election as president of Egypt.
					Kim in the message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would steadily grow in the future and sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work to ensure the stability of the country and achieve its economic development and prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to New Pakistani PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to New Pakistani PM
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a congratulatory message to Raza Pervez Ashraf upon his election as prime minister of Pakistan. 
					Convinced that the good friendly and cooperative ties between the peoples of the DPRK and Pakistan will further develop in the future, the message wished the prime minister great success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A Chinese film delegation headed by Tong Gang, director of the film management bureau of the Chinese State Administration of Radio, Film and Television, on Tuesday visited statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill to pay homage.
					They laid bouquets and bowed before the statues.
					
					They arrived here on the same day to take part in the preview of the DPRK-China co-production "Promise in Pyongyang".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Message from Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Message from Democratic Congo
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message on June 13 from the participants of a mass rally held in Democratic Congo to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					The message said:
					
					Kim Jong Il was an internationally recognized outstanding statesman, tender-hearted father of the Korean people and an illustrious commander of Songun who defended socialist Korea with matchless will and stratagem.
					
					Since he started his work at the Central Committee of the WPK, it has been more firmly consolidated on the basis of the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung and steadily developed into the party absolutely supported and trusted by all people.
					
					He steadily developed the undying Juche idea as the greatest revolutionary idea in the independence era, providing an ideological and theoretical weapon to the world progressive people.
					
					Kim Jong Il defeated the imperialists' intensified moves against the DPRK with the original Songun leadership and turned the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power which the world people envy.
					
					The exploits performed by him in the Korean revolution and global independence will be remembered forever by the Korean people and the world progressive people.
					
					The brave Korean people will display to the full their resourcefulness and the might of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's nation in the effort for building a thriving socialist country, united close behind Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Comes Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Comes Back Home
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Bureau of Civil Aviation of the DPRK headed by its Director General Kang Ki Sop came back home on Tuesday after wrapping up visit to Russia.

articles.title: Chinese Laud DPRK Opera "The Flower Girl" as World Masterpiece
articles.content:
Chinese People Laud DPRK Opera "The Flower Girl" as World Masterpiece
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- "The Flower Girl", the DPRK's revolutionary opera, which is on in China is evoking great response among the Chinese audience.
					The Chinese audience was greatly excited to see the opera that was staged in the Lanzhou Grand Theater and the Chongqing Grand Theater of Gansu Province.
					
					Zhou Lining, vice-mayor of Lanzhou City, Gansu Province, after appreciating the opera said that he was deeply moved by the arts of the DPRK.
					
					Vice-manager of a company He Ying noted that he was carried away by the beautiful voices and fascinating and attractive dances of the DPRK artistes.
					
					Tang Fangmei, manager of a company in Chongqing, said in the excited tone that the acting of the artistes was vivid and their dances mesmerized the audience.
					
					Li Xiaorong, manager of a commercial unit in Chongqing, noted that he could not repress admiration at the stage arts, adding that such an elaborate stage decor can be seen only in the operas of the DPRK.
					
					Tian Mei, manager of a factory in Chongqing, said that he saw the feature film of the DPRK "The Flower Girl" in the 1970s and was deeply impressed with the film and so was he with the opera this time, adding that he has never seen such an excellent opera.
					
					Yang Hong, vice news editor of a magazine, noted that the opera is a world masterpiece, and he has already known that the opera is one of the five revolutionary operas of the DPRK, adding that he is anxious to visit the DPRK to watch those five operas.

articles.title: Football Matches between DPRK, China Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Football Matches between DPRK, China Held in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A U-19 football friendly between the DPRK and China took place at Yanggakdo Football Stadium in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					The match ended in a tie 3:3.
					
					Both the DPRK and China are qualified for the 2012 Asian U-19 Football Championship.
					
					The DPRK belongs to Group C, along with Jordan, Vietnam and Uzbekistan. It came first in the 2006 and 2010 Asian U-19 Football Championships.
					
					China is to play in Group B.
					
					The Chinese team beat the DPRK's Taesongsan Football Team 2:0 in a match held on June 23.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Metal Industry in North Hamgyong Province
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Metal Industry in N. Hamgyong Province
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, made a field survey of metal industry in North Hamgyong Province.
					He visited various places of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and the Chongjin Steel Works alive with the drive to boost rolled steel production and complete technological updating to acquaint himself with production there, its prospect and progress made in their modernization.
					
					There took place a joint meeting of officials in the field of metal industry of the Cabinet and the province.
					
					The meeting discussed measures to steadily boost the production at the Kim Chaek Iron Steel Complex, Musan Mining Complex, Chongjin Steel Works and Puryong Alloy Steel Works and ensure the indigenous production of custom-built equipment needed for the development of metal industry.
					
					It also underscored the need to conduct all economic work in a responsible manner from the viewpoint of meeting the interests of the party, revolution and people. It, in particular, called for improving the organization and direction of production activity and supply of raw and other materials to the complexes in the field of metal industry.
					
					He stressed the important role the metal industry in the province is playing in the efforts to carry out the last instructions of leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un's plan for building an economic power and took relevant economic steps.
					
					Meanwhile, he toured the construction site of the Orangchon Power Station and took measures for completing Phalhyang Dam Construction and Power Station No. 2 ahead of schedule.

articles.title: Fourth Commodity Exhibition Opens at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1
articles.content:
Fourth Commodity Exhibition Opens at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Fourth Commodity Exhibition was opened with due ceremony at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1 on Tuesday. 
					On display there are more than 3.3 million consumer goods of some 1 500 kinds produced by hundreds of industrial establishments and joint-venture companies across the country.
					
					Present there were Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Minister of Commerce Ri Song Ho, officials concerned, officials of ministries, national institutions and units for provision of goods and citizens. 
					
					Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin in an opening address called for making the exhibition a momentum for turning to good account the achievements and experience and producing more goods popular among the people and competitive in the international market.

articles.title: Commendations Awarded to Schoolgirl's Parents, Teachers
articles.content:
Commendations Awarded to Schoolgirl's Parents, Teachers
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Commendations were awarded to parents and teachers who brought up Han Hyon Gyong, fourth-year student of Inphung Secondary School, Sinhung County, South Hamgyong Province, the DPRK to be a displayer of the spirit of devotedly defending the leader. 
					The title of Merited Teacher was awarded to Nam Hye Wol, a class teacher, Order of National Flag (First Class) to mother Han Kum Suk and Principal of the School Ri Kyong Sun, Order of Labour to father Han Myong Su and Vice Principal Kim Ok Bun, Order of National Flag (Second Class) to Rim Myong Chol, chief instructor of the school youth league and children's union committees, and Order of National Flag (Third Class) to Ri Won Il, instructor of the school children's union committee.
					
					A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on the commendations was issued on June 23.

articles.title: Aid System for Education in Foreign Languages Developed
articles.content:
Aid System for Education in Foreign Languages Developed
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A new aid system for education in foreign languages was developed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					The system is capable of providing the learners of foreign languages with good audio-visual conditions, composed of a main frame, a keyboard, handsets and TV connector.
					
					Its advantage is to enjoy videos on TV. It has neither change in sound quality and nor noise in listening or conversing.
					
					Controlled by a keyboard, the user can listen to teacher's explanation and have dialogue with teacher or other learner.
					
					The system has the function of review, too.
					
					Ri Jae Hun, section chief of the Educational Information Exchange Agency, told KCNA that the system has already been applied to Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry, Pyongyang College of Statistics, Pyongyang Hasin Primary School and other educational institutions.

articles.title: Changjon Street, Glimpse of Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Changjon Street, Glimpse of Thriving Nation
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Tension is running higher on the Korean Peninsula due to large-scale military exercises jointly held by the United States, Japan and south Korea in the West Sea of Korea.
					Not affected by the situation, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is pressing ahead with construction projects in the capital city of Pyongyang.
					
					In this regard, KCNA met Kim Song Dok, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee.
					
					Q: DPRK-targeted war drills have been kicked off one after another in the area south of the Military Demarcation Line. 
					
					But, Pyongyang is now overcome by enthusiasm to finish the projects of edifices in time. Some days ago, a ceremony for the completion of Changjon Street took place in the city.
					
					What do you think about it?
					
					A: Modernly-built Changjon Street represents the will of the dear respected Kim Jong Un to build a thriving nation on any accounts as well as the determination of the DPRK people to bring about a rosier future.
					
					The U.S. and its allies' anti-DPRK moves are getting more undisguised in military, political and economic aspects.
					
					For example, the U.S. forces, together with the south Korean puppet army, launched the biggest-ever joint firing exercise in the area south of the Demilitarized Zone, with the DPRK flag as the target.
					
					Our economic situation is still difficult due to the sanctions and blockade of the hostile forces.
					
					Furthermore, the farming in the country has been severely affected by the devastating drought.
					
					However, the DPRK servicepersons and civilians do not feel dismay at such difficulties.
					
					The People's Theatre was already opened and a primary school, kindergarten and nursery in Changjon Street are ready to open.
					
					Removal to new houses has begun, and the first wedding ceremony was held at a restaurant in the street, under the deep attention of Kim Jong Un and amid great interest of Pyongyang citizens.
					
					The DPRK people will surely build a thriving nation as they have the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, the best socialist system and the single-minded unity.

articles.title: DPRK's West Coastal Area Experiences Exceptionally Hot Weather
articles.content:
DPRK's West Coastal Area Experiences Exceptionally Hot Weather
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The west coastal area in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is suffering from exceptionally high temperatures, as well as a long spell of drought.
					The highest temperature in most of the area in late May was 3 to 8 degrees C and from mid-June 7 degrees C higher than the average.
					
					On June 24, Pyongyang City witnessed 35 degrees C, Phyongsong and Sariwon cities 34, Nampho City 33 and Haeju City 32, the highest ever in the areas since the beginning of meteorological observation.
					
					Such phenomenon is ascribable to the high pressure above the East Sea of Korea expanding up to the west coastal area, allowing the hot air to steadily come towards Korea from the south.
					
					High temperature is likely to linger in the area.

articles.title: Kim Kum Sun, 9-Year-Old Hero of Korea
articles.content:
Kim Kum Sun, 9-Year-Old Hero of Korea
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Many heroes have been produced in every period of the Korean revolution crowned with victory and glory. Among them is Kim Kum Sun (1925-1934), who sacrificed herself at the age of 9 to keep secret of the revolutionary organization.
					A member of the Anti-Japanese Children's Corps, Kim creditably carried out tasks assigned by the Corps and distinguished herself in activities of its art troupe.
					
					She gained fame through art performances arousing soldiers of the (Chinese) National Salvation Army to the joint struggle against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					The guerillas and inhabitants of the guerilla base loved this little girl so much, and President Kim Il Sung praised her as a wit.
					
					She pepped up the guerrillas and people in the battle to defend Xiaowangqing guerrilla base and other fights against the Japanese imperialists by shouting revolutionary slogans and singing militant songs together with other members of the Children's Corps.
					
					In the autumn of Juche 23 (1934) Kim Kum Sun was arrested by the Japanese military police after delivering a message of the revolutionary organization in Yaoyinggou to the enemy-controlled area. But, she kept secret of the organization despite the enemy's appeasement, threat and tortures. "Down with the Japanese imperialists! Long live the Korean revolution!" -- this was what she shouted out at the execution site.
					
					Standing at Kim Kum Sun Secondary School in Sinuiju City, North Phyongan Province, the DPRK, is a statue of this girl, well-known as a juvenile revolutionary and hero.
					
					Inheriting the revolutionary traditions of the Anti-Japanese Children's Corps, members of the Korean Children's Union bravely fought against the U.S. aggressors in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953).
					
					Today millions of KCU members prepare themselves to be juvenile heroes like Kim Kum Sun and pillars of thriving Korea under the loving care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Brands U.S. as Provoker of Korean War
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Brands U.S. as Provoker of Korean War
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- How did the Korean War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953) break out?
					MacArthur, the then commander of the U.S. forces in the Far East and commander of the UN forces, sent a message to Japanese Prime Minister Yoshida on June 26, 1950, asking him to order Akahata, the organ of the Communist Party of Japan, to suspend its operation for 30 days from June 27. 
					
					The newspaper reported at that time that MacArthur made such request because it reported that the puppet army of Syngman Rhee illegally intruded into the northern half of Korea across the 38th Parallel. 
					
					This was just a very tiny example of the U.S. imperialists' moves to cover up the true colors as provoker of the Korean War. 
					
					The international political situation and the balance of forces in the international relations at the time when the Korean War broke out were very unfavorable for the U.S. strategy for world domination. 
					
					After the end of the Second World War, the People's Republic of China was proclaimed and the friendly alliance between the Soviet Union and China was formed. The national liberation struggle and democratic forces grew stronger in all regions of Asia including Korea and Vietnam. The U.S. ruling quarters were busy shifting the responsibility for the failure of their Far East strategy onto each other. 
					
					The influence of the socialist camp steadily grew in the international arena and the anti-imperialist struggle for national liberation mounted in many countries which had been under the domination and yoke of imperialists. 
					
					Meanwhile, the U.S. military industrial complexes and the financial situation of Wall Street badly needed a war of aggression. 
					
					The U.S. economy greeted a heyday after raking up huge profits through massive production and sale of weapons during World War II. But, it began gradually sinking into depression in 1946. 
					
					It was against the backdrop of a start of arms race and extreme horror of economic depression, the worst in the U.S. history that the U.S. political and military authorities decided to launch the Korean War as a way out of this. 
					
					The British magazine Economist said that the U.S. needed an opportunity of weathering the crisis and had no option but to invent a war. 
					
					The U.S. option for the Korean War to tide over the economic crisis spurred the revival of Japan. 
					
					The article "U.S. policy for colonizing Japan" written by Prof. Konstantin Popov carried in Izbestiya of the then Soviet Union said: 
					
					"From a military viewpoint, the U.S. is encouraging the development of Japanese industry to be effectively used for arming the Japanese forces now being revived by the MacArthur command. 
					
					"This policy of the U.S. occupation authorities stemmed from the policy of the U.S. ruling quarters keen to turn Japan into their military bridgehead in the Far East. 
					
					"As of early 1950, the total amount of the U.S. investment in Japan reached 2.5 billion U.S. dollars. 
					
					"The U.S. war provokers plan to use Japan as a springboard for carrying out their Far Eastern military strategy while the Japanese ruling quarters hope to use the Korean War for implementing their scenarios for revenge."
					
					The U.S. ignited the Korean War as it was much upset by the daily growing political, economic and military potentials of the DPRK.
					
					Five days before the outbreak of the Korean War, a correspondent of the Swiss paper Neue Zurcher Zeitung said in his Far East report as follows:
					
					"From an economic point of view, south Korea is in a difficult situation. Most of the profit-making industrial establishments and major power stations are located in the northern half of Korea. The Syngman Rhee clique sought a way out of the catastrophic situation in invading north Korea. 
					
					"There are many people in south Korea who seek a way for settling the difficult economic problem in the military invasion of north Korea. 100 000 troops well trained by Americans plus 50 000-strong police of south Korea can surely outrival the army of north Korea." 
					
					Yukorolkov, TASS correspondent in Berlin at that time, wrote as follows, saying he had photos taken by AP correspondent in south Korea: 
					
					The American correspondent left a photo showing the first phase of invasion of north Korea from the 38th Parallel. 
					
					Prominent in the photo is John Foster Dulles, one of the war merchants and adviser to the U.S. secretary of State. 
					
					Dulles is closely examining the preparations for the imminent combat actions, standing in the trench. He was inspecting fully battle ready troops of south Korea, surrounded by American officers and soldiers of the mercenary army of Syngman Rhee. 
					
					Zhou Enlai, the then premier and foreign minister of the Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China, on June 28, 1950 issued the following statement as regards Truman's June 27 statement on intervention in Korea:
					
					Truman's statement openly disclosed his military plan and, at the same time, was aimed at putting it into practice. 
					
					In fact, the Syngman Rhee puppet regime's attack on the DPRK through the agitation of the U.S. government was kicked off by the U.S. for the purpose of securing a pretext for invading Taiwan, Korea, Vietnam, etc.
					
					This is the U.S. imperialists' renewed interference in Asian affairs. 
					
					According to a TASS report dated June 29, 1950 from New York, a member of the House of Representatives from the Workers' Party of the U.S. said that the U.S. was unnecessarily fighting a war against the north Korean government. 
					
					He predicted that Truman's actions would bring miserable consequences to the American people. 
					
					All these facts provide historical evidence proving that the U.S. is the provoker of the Korean War and the U.S. can never evade the responsibility for it.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses U.S. Aim in Interfering in S. Korea's "Presidential" Election
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses U.S. Aim in Interfering in S. Korea's "Presidential" Election
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has let its heavyweights visit Seoul in succession recently, a sign of its deep concern about the "presidential election" due in south Korea late this year.
					The U.S. is getting itself deeply involved in the "presidential election" in south Korea, becoming undisguised in interference in it.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					This is aimed to help the pro-U.S. conservative regime stay in power and, through it, realize the strategy for domination of Korea.
					
					Citing facts to prove that whenever new regime appeared in south Korea, the U.S. made intervention in an undisguised and cunning manner, the article goes on:
					
					The U.S. interference in the "election" is aimed to seat a pro-U.S. stooge like traitor Lee Myung Bak on the chair of power.
					
					The south Korean conservative group is working hard to cover up its hideous crimes through the frantic racket for "eliminating the forces following the north" and divert elsewhere the public criticism. It also seeks to prove its pro-U.S. stand and its firm policy of confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					If the wicked forces following the U.S. who pledged to "fight to death for the interests of the U.S." are allowed to stay in power, the south Koreans will suffer again.
					
					The conspiracy between the U.S. and the clan of the "Saenuri Party" is an intolerable mockery and insult to the south Korean people who are anxious to see independence, democracy and reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules Japan Dependent on U.S.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules Japan Dependent on U.S.
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government has recently contemplated deploying the U.S.-made MV-22 Osprey military transport aircraft at a U.S. military base in Okinawa Prefecture.
					This indicates the U.S. desperate efforts meant to turn Okinawa into a sortie and advanced base for invading Korea and the rest of Asia.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					What matters is that Japan is being played into the hands of the U.S. for its strategic needs and interests.
					
					The removal of the U.S. military base from Futenma is not a mere military and business-like issue. It is a touchstone judging whether Japan has the will and capability to pursue an independent policy with its opinion free from the shackle of its master.
					
					The massive deployment of the above-said aircraft is becoming a reality while the removal of the base is becoming less and less possible. It is just like receiving more kicks than halfpence.
					
					What is tragic is that such a behavior is an inevitable choice for Japan as a stooge. Just after the defeat of the Japanese imperialists the U.S. put Japan under its control in chains of master-servant relations of alliance. This made Japan unable to think of anything its own way.
					
					Japan's policy has long turned its back on public mind-set, pleasing the U.S. and following its politics. This is because the Japanese politicians entrusted their political fate to their U.S. master.
					
					Japan is not properly dealing with the issue of military base in its land while kowtowing to outsiders. This is just a miserable fate of lackey depending on its master without any principle.

articles.title: U.S. anti-DPRK Sanctions Are Bound to Go Bankrupt: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. anti-DPRK Sanctions Are Bound to Go Bankrupt: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. decided on June 18 to extend one more year the economic sanctions on the DPRK that had been in force since 2008 banning the transaction of assets. 
					The U.S. claims that the extension was taken because the DPRK constantly escalated tensions. But it is just an extension of its hostile policy towards the DPRK and sophism to cover its sinister intention in every aspect, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Tuesday. It continues:
					
					The situation of the DPRK proves that the imperialists' policy of sanctions is anachronistic and it is bound to go bankrupt for its injustice.
					
					No matter how desperately the U.S. tries to wield the stick of sanctions, an old means it used to employ when pressurizing other countries, it will prove futile.
					
					The DPRK has never been frightened by such sanctions nor has it begged the U.S. to lift them.
					
					The people of the DPRK have so far lived, being exposed to sanctions by the U.S. They are now vigorously advancing toward the day when they will lead the happiest life in the world in the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance full of hope and great ambitions.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK are united in single mind. The unity is the most powerful weapon in the world which even A-bomb can not break.
					
					The U.S. can never dream of having such a powerful weapon.
					
					The DPRK will keep to the path chosen by itself, not reading others' face no matter what they say.
					
					It is preposterous for the U.S. to try to browbeat the people of the DPRK through such sanctions.

articles.title: Korean War Is Inevitable Product of U.S. Policy
articles.content:
Korean War Is Inevitable Product of U.S. Policy
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Sixty two years have passed since the Korean War was ignited by the U.S. imperialists.
					The war was an inevitable product of the U.S. imperialists' internal and external policy.
					
					After World War II, the balance of political forces of the world rapidly changed in favor of the democratic forces' holding of edge over the imperialist forces.
					
					The Democratic People's Republic of Korea successfully enforced various democratic reforms and embarked on the road of socialism under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, who achieved the historic cause of the country's liberation.
					
					The then Soviet Union turned into a socialist power after winning the war against fascism.
					
					A people's republic was founded in China in October 1949 and democratic reforms were enforced there.
					
					Vietnam declared the founding of a democratic republic and strived to win the people's democracy.
					
					Poland, Romania and other nations of Eastern Europe vigorously advanced towards socialism.
					
					The global expansion of socialist forces, the growth of international democratic forces and the mounting struggle for national liberation in colonial countries threatened imperialism.
					
					The U.S. imperialists plotted to bring about a fresh global war in a bid to reorganize the weak imperialist forces and contain the socialist forces. 
					
					Their first step was the Korean War.
					
					The U.S. imperialists, which turned south Korea to a bridgehead of aggression on Asia and a strategic base for checking the movement for national liberation and socialism and holding world hegemony, ignited the war on June 25, 1950.

articles.title: Undeniable Fact about Provocation of Korean War
articles.content:
Undeniable Fact about Provocation of Korean War
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Over the past 60 odd years, the United States has insisted that the Korean War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953) was started with the "southward invasion" by the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					History, however, denies such insistence of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					MacArthur, the then commander of the U.S. forces in the Far East, told a U.S. Senate hearing in May 1951 that the north Korean forces were deployed much far from the 38th parallel and the deployment was not for attack. He also said that the south Korean forces had amassed all their military supplies and hardware in the areas along the 38th parallel and their deployment formation was not for defense in depth.
					
					It was also disclosed that the then U.S. president, Truman, gave officials of the Defense and State departments Order No. 29 on launching a general attack at dawn of June 25, 1950. The order was delivered, through the command of the U.S. forces in the Far East, to field commands of the south Korean forces on June 21, to each regiment on June 24 and to each company at dawn of June 25.
					
					Meanwhile, the U.S. imperialists let units under the U.S. 5th Air Force in Japan take part in the Korean War from June 25.
					
					An American war veteran testified to the fact that the 68th and 339th fighter squadrons and the 25th fighter-bomber squadron under the U.S. 5th Air Force made 163 sorties from Japan on June 25.
					
					According to American book "Who Began the Korean War?", a war scenarios for aggression on the DPRK had already and completely been worked out and the war preparations were rounded off as of May 1950 on the part of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					India's newspaper Crossroads reported in its Dec. 23 issue in 1950 that Colonel Eida, who had been a staff officer of the U.S. Forces Command in the Far East, said that the south Korean army started the war by the direct order of the U.S. general headquarters in Japan.
					
					It is the undeniable truth that the U.S. started the Korean War.

articles.title: Japan, Belligerent State of Korean War
articles.content:
Japan, Belligerent State of Korean War
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Japan is a state that actively participated in the Korean War (June 1950-July 1953) started by the U.S. imperialists. 
					Many remnants of the "Imperial Japanese Army", including Kawabe, who was deputy chief of the General Staff of the army, were mobilized in working out a plan for the Korean War.
					
					Japan offered all of its material and human resources to the U.S. imperialists during the war.
					
					In 1949 alone, it handed over to the south Korean puppet army such military munitions as tens of thousands of firearms, thousands of artillery pieces, hundreds of thousands of shells and flame throwers and thousands of vehicles.
					
					Japan did not officially join the "UN Forces" organized by the U.S. but played a key role in the war, next to the U.S. forces.
					
					It dispatched ground, naval and air forces to the Korean War earlier than any allies of the U.S. to directly take part in battles and give assistance to operations and battles conducted by the U.S. and south Korean forces in capacity of advisers and staff officers.
					
					A host of Japanese seamen took the lead in helping the U.S. forces' landing operation and many pilots, including members of the Kamikaze Commando, flew to the Korean War.
					
					Experimental data, reference materials, designs of germ bombs, research institutions and equipment, which were in the possession of the notorious Unit 731 under the "Imperial Japanese Army", were wholly transferred to the U.S. forces. And Japan volunteered to take charge of production of bacteria to be used in germ warfare.
					
					Japan sent many troops to the Korean war under the disguise of "volunteer army", "volunteers" and "units of Koreans in Japan".
					
					Meanwhile, its whole territory served as a logistic and repairing base for the U.S. and its allied forces.
					
					In a word, Japan is a special-class criminal state which inflicted immense misfortunes and sufferings upon the Korean people, siding with the U.S. imperialists in the Korean War.

articles.title: Danger of U.S.-S. Korean Naval Drill Exposed
articles.content:
Danger of U.S.-S. Korean Naval Drill Exposed
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers staged a combined naval mobile drill with the U.S. in the West Sea of Korea from June 23 to 25.
					Involved in the drill were more than 10 warships including George Washington and destroyers, submarines, F-15K and carrier-based aircrafts as well as over 8 000 troops of Naval and Air Forces of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet army.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					This is a serious military threat to the DPRK and an unpardonable act of wrecking the peace which escalates the tension on the Korean Peninsula and in Northeast Asia.
					
					The combined drill is a clear revelation of an aim to preempt attacks on the north.
					
					The drill in the West Sea of Korea immediately followed the joint naval drill of the U.S., Japan and south Korea in the waters south of Jeju Island. 
					
					What should not be overlooked is the George Washington's involvement. 
					
					This clearly proves the sinister intention of the U.S. and the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors to make a preemptive surprise attack on the DPRK from the West Sea of Korea where the military tension between the north and the south of Korea runs highest, while making the provocation of a new war a fait accompli.
					
					The joint military drill against the DPRK is a desperate effort of the Lee Myung Bak regime to get rid of destruction. The military cooperation with outside forces and the provocative drill for a war would never be a way-out for the group of traitors.

articles.title: S. Korea to Buy U.S. Secondhand Combat Cars for Use at Anti-DPRK War
articles.content:
S. Korea to Buy U.S. Secondhand Combat Cars for Use at Anti-DPRK War
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Lee Myung Bak regime is going to "introduce U.S. mine-proof special combat cars for use in operation of combat engineers" to clear the ways to the north when there breaks out "emergency in the north", according to the south Korean World Daily on June 19. The mission of the special combat cars is to remove mines planted in the north side of the Military Demarcation Line (MDL), said the daily. 
					Minju Joson on Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					There existed so far many fanatics who escalated confrontation with compatriots but no such warmongers who openly abetted breakthrough of the MDL and sped up preparation for it.
					
					In fact, the Lee group of traitors is beset with the danger of emergency. The group is now driven into a tight corner by the people home and abroad for the crimes it perpetrated while in power. Under such situation the group is accelerating anti-north war preparations, citing "emergency in the north". This is nothing but a reflection of its sinister intention to remain in power under the wings of the U.S.
					
					What can not be tolerated is the Lee group's reckless act of fattening up the U.S. by laying in secondhand goods.
					
					The combat cars the U.S. is going to sell to south Korea are worn-out things used in the Afghan war. The U.S. is pretending to be generous by selling off tens of thousands of cars whose disposal it was troubled with.
					
					Lee group's aim is to curry favor with the U.S. in order to survive deposal under the protection of it first and invade the DPRK some time later.
					
					But its rabid moves are a suicidal act hastening its doom.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Announce Plan for Restoring Combat Forces
articles.content:
S. Korea Announces Plan for Restoring Combat Forces
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The 22nd Division of the south Korean puppet army announced that it would stage a drill for restoring combat forces in areas of Kosong and Sokcho of South Korean Kangwon Province from June 26 to 28, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					The drill is reportedly aimed to promptly recover big losses in forces, equipment, etc. in a war period. 
					
					As part of thepreparations for a war against the DPRK, the projected drill clearly indicates that the south Korean warmongers are making desperate efforts to ignite a war of aggression at any cost.

articles.title: S. Korean Freight Workers' Solidarity Calls for Right to Existence
articles.content:
S. Korean Freight Workers' Solidarity Calls for Right to Existence
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Freight Workers' Solidarity of the Transport Workers' Union under the Confederation of Trade Unions of south Korea launched an indefinite general strike for the right to existence on June 25, according to south Korean MBC.
					More than 300 000 unionists under the organization took part in the strike.
					
					Railway, airport and port trade unions supported the Freight Workers' Solidarity, clarifying their stand to refuse the authorities' demand to transport freight to substitute those now on a strike.
					
					Meanwhile, the authorities openly disclosed their attempt at suppression, threatening to punish the strikers ranging from the suspension of license to criminal punishment.

articles.title: S. Korean Trade Unions Call for Wage-hike
articles.content:
S. Korean Trade Unions Call for Wage-hike
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Trade Unions staged a sit-in strike in Seoul on June 21 in demand of a wage-hike.
					The organizations held a meeting before launching the sit-in.
					
					At the meeting speakers recalled that the Lee Myung Bak "government" broke down the meeting for deciding the minimum wage for 2013 from its beginning.
					
					They accused the "government" of speaking for the interests of the employer side and seeking to set low the minimum wage.
					
					The workers can no longer live in poverty, the speakers said, calling for actions against it.
					
					The participants expressed their will to fight against the "government" authorities' misrule.

articles.title: Koreans in China Call for Displaying Patriotism in Unity
articles.content:
Koreans in China Call for Displaying Patriotism in Unity
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China made public a statement on June 16 in support of the appeal to all Koreans at home and abroad issued by the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration.
					It was thanks to the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration provided by leader Kim Jong Il that all Koreans in the north, south and abroad could start joint actions to put an end to the history of national division and usher in a new era of national reconciliation, unity, peace and reunification, the statement said, and went on:
					
					The ultra-right conservative group of south Korea including traitor Lee Myung Bak and conservative media leveled gun at the compatriots in the north who were suffering the greatest loss to the nation, malignantly hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and spoke ill of the celebrations of the Day of the Sun and the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union. These thrice-cursed crimes touched off towering resentment of all the Koreans.
					
					The Koreans in China will turn out in the vigorous drive to implement the joint declaration.
					
					We condemn the DPRK-targeted joint military exercises and arms buildup now under way across south Korea and will pool efforts in the sacred struggle to frustrate them.
					
					We will shatter the attempt of knocking into shape the triangular military alliance for aggression among the U.S., Japan and south Korea as it gravely threatens peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in Northeast Asia. We will also pull the U.S. forces, the prime mover of national division and main source of all misfortune and pains, out of south Korea and thus root out the source of war from Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech to Children Introduced by Austrian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Unâ€²s Congratulatory Speech to Children Introduced by Austrian Organization
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria published in its bulletin on June 13 an article titled "The Joint National Meeting of Korean Children's Union On June 6, 2012."
					The bulletin carried the gist of the congratulatory speech made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the meeting together with a photo of him present at the joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations in celebration of its 66th birthday.
					
					He in his speech expressed his steadfast will to invariably carry forward the noble outlook of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on future and the rising generation.
					
					He also indicated tasks and ways for bringing up the KCU members to be reserves, knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy, who will be responsible for the future destiny of the country and the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Supported by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Supported by British Organization
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Stoke-on-Trent Branch of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea extended full support to the recently published works of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					The branch said in its statement on June 17 Kim Jong Un made energetic ideological and theoretical activities to fully develop Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism. 
					
					The statement went on:
					
					Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, made public several works this year including "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" and "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche."
					
					The works only encourage the Korean people in the cause of building a thriving socialist country but greatly inspire the world progressive people in the struggle against imperialism.
					
					In the works he called for defending and glorifying the immortal exploits performed by the preceding leaders of the revolution.
					
					The works prove that Kim Jong Un is a great man who is intensely faithful to the cause of global independence and socialism while making total dedication to carrying out the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					We call upon the world progressives to study hard his works which give perfect answers to the questions arising as regards ideology and theory of socialism and their implementation in the 21st century.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Introduced Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Introduced Abroad
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential For Accomplishing Socialism" was carried in the June 18 issue of Natun Bangla of Bangladesh and in the bulletin of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on June 19.
					The work, published on June 19, 1995, clarifies the idea that in order to successfully accomplish the socialist cause it is necessary to give top priority to the ideological work. It also says the basic task of the ideological work is to imbue whole society with the socialist idea and that the ideological work should be conducted on the principle and method suited to the intrinsic requirements of socialism.
					
					The Peruvian group also carried his work "Socialism Is a Science".

articles.title: WPK History Introduced by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
WPK History Introduced by Foreign Newspapers
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special-write-ups to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					The Lao papers Pasason, Vatelao, Congtap Pasason Lao and Heng Ngan on June 19 carried articles titled "On the occasion of 48th anniversary of Comrade Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Party Central Committee" and "Fluttering flag of WPK" with portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					The papers said that he strenuously carried out the party work with iron faith and will, regarding it as his lifelong mission to strengthen the WPK into the eternal party of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The history of the WPK is a brilliant course in which it has constantly advanced, invariably holding the banner of socialism.
					
					The Indonesian paper Suara Karya on the same day said that the WPK has achieved firm unity in thinking and purpose and in terms of moral obligation on the basis of one idea and center under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, and is giving full play to its might as the guiding force.
					
					The Ugandan paper Sun Rise on June 18 devoted its one whole page to special write-ups with the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					The paper said he clearly indicated a way of the progressive people of the world to build a free and peaceful new society, opposing domination, subjugation, aggression and war, and wisely led the struggle to realize it.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries and by international organizations between June 5 and 23 to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					Meetings, seminars, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Russia, Mexico, Ethiopia, South Africa, Uganda, Indonesia, India, Nigeria and Malaysia and by the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement and the Regional Development Office of the FIFA.
					
					Displayed at their venues were works of Kim Jong Il and books and photos of his feats.
					
					The general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico said that Kim Jong Il developed and enriched the Juche idea through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities and consolidated the unity and cohesion of the party in thinking and will as firm as a rock.
					
					By pursuing the original Songun politics, he wisely led the Korean people to defend the dignity and sovereignty of the country and build a thriving nation, the general secretary noted.
					
					The chairman of the Kampala City Committee of the Uganda National Resistance Movement said that prosperity of socialist Korea is a shining fruition of Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership. He praised the undying feats of Kim Jong Il, who strengthened the WPK into an invincible party.
					
					The chief of a branch of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea noted that Kim Jong Il made sure that it was specified in the party rules that the WPK is the eternal party of President Kim Il Sung and a steady continuity is given to the tradition of unity and cohesion.
					
					The chairman of the Russian Youth Society for the Study of the Juche Idea praised the dear respected Kim Jong Un for carrying forward the ideas and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar in Russia.
					
					Korean films shown included "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Party Founding Memorial Tower".

articles.title: History of Sun Will Go On in DPRK
articles.content:
History of Sun Will Go On in DPRK
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Ukrainian Branch of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks on June 15 posted an article titled "DPRK" on its Internet website to mark the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					In July every year the Korean people would recollect Kim Il Sung, the father of the nation, generalissimo and eternal President of the DPRK, the article said, and went on:
					
					The whole life of the President was a great life reflective of the history of the Korean revolution in the 20th century.
					
					The Korean people were liberated from the fate of colonial slaves of Japanese imperialism, defeated the U.S. imperialists and their allies in the Fatherland Liberation War and made great achievements in all fields of the state and social life. That was possible because they were led by Kim Il Sung, an outstanding statesman and strategist.  
					
					He was the founder and leader of the Workers' Party of Korea, the DPRK and the Korean People's Army.
					
					The Juche idea founded by him serves as the eternal guiding idea of the WPK. He successfully settled the issue of inheritance of leadership in line with the situation of the DPRK. It is thanks to the wise leadership of the peerlessly great persons that the national self-confidence and pride of the Korean people have reached the highest ground and the whole world is praising them as the strongest and talented people.
					
					The Korean revolution will triumphantly advance in the future, too, as it is led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is successfully inheriting the cause of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The Korean people are praising the brilliant life of the President as the history of the sun. The history of the sun will be given a steady continuity.

articles.title: U.S. "Human Rights Report" Rejected by UK Organizations
articles.content:
U.S. "Human Rights Report" Rejected by UK Organizations
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on June 12 in support of a statement of a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry condemning the U.S. "2011 human rights report".
					The joint statement said that the U.S. is interfering in the internal affairs of the DPRK and tarnishing its image while styling itself "a world justice", adding this is a height of imperialist arrogance.
					
					The U.S. is the world's worst human rights abuser, it noted, and went on:
					
					The U.S. "human rights report" was based on lies and fabrications made by traitors and criminals who betrayed the country for a petty amount of money given by the south Korean puppet authorities.
					
					People in the DPRK are enjoying genuine human rights in the socialist system centering on the popular masses.
					
					The U.S. annual "human rights report" is just a crafty and base move to tarnish the image of Korean-style socialism centering on the popular masses. It is also part of the moves to force the DPRK into "opening" which is meant to stifle Korean socialist system.
					
					We call upon the world progressive forces to strongly reject the U.S. human rights offensive and positively defend socialism of Juche Korea.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Accused of Their Moves to Revive Militarism
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Accused of Their Moves to Revive Militarism
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- More than ten sooty-faced soldiers of the Japan Ground "Self-Defence Force" with field bags on their back and rifles and bayonets marched through streets of Itabashi and Nerima wards of Tokyo on June 12.
					DPRK major paper Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					This odd happening reminds one of the eve of a war. It indicates what a dangerous phase Japan has reached in reviving militarism.
					
					Japan's militarism has so far been veiled with watchwords of "peace" and "security". But it is now working in real earnest to revive it, discarding the veil. 
					
					The revival of militarism is a long-cherished political ambition of the Japanese reactionaries. 
					
					It is the scenario of Japan to emerge an ordinary state with the right to participate in a war, the right of belligerency and the right to have regular armed forces, like before its defeat at World War II, and thus realize its old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" without fail.
					
					To this end, the Japanese reactionaries have long sped up their preparations to turn Japan into a military giant and revive militarism, pulling the wool over the eyes of the international community.
					
					All arrangements have already been made in secret for becoming a war state. What remains to be done by the Japanese reactionaries is to eliminate all the institutional and social hurdles in the way of realizing overseas expansion.
					
					It is as clear as noonday that the whole of Tokyo will be disturbed by the march of 100 000, nay one million battle-ready soldiers though just more than ten saber-rattlers staged such ruckus there recently.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries will perish in the flames kindled by themselves if they finally opt for reinvasion, defying the opposition of the international community and the public to Japan's militarism. Then it will testify to the lesson taught by history.

articles.title: Iwaguni City Rejects U.S. Plan to Deploy Transport Aircrafts
articles.content:
Iwaguni City Rejects U.S. Plan to Deploy Transport Aircraft
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Iwaguni City assembly of Yamaguchi Prefecture, Japan on June 22 adopted a document rejecting the U.S. plan to deploy accident-prone MV-22 Osprey in the city.
					The document said the citizens were greatly concerned about the plan.
					
					The assembly is strongly opposed to the plan, the document said, urging the government to take the matter into serious consideration.

articles.title: MINREX rechaza reporte de EE.UU. sobre el "trafico de personas"
articles.content:
MINREX rechaza reporte de EE.UU. sobre el "trafico de personas"
Pyongyang, 26 de junio (ACNC) -- En entrevista concedida a la ACNC con respecto a la acusacion de Estados Unidos a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea del supuesto problema de "trafico de personas", el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el lunes la siguiente respuesta:
					En su recien publicado "reporte sobre el trafico de personas", el Departamento de Estado de EE.UU. cometio la provocacion politica de calumniar siniestramente a la RPDC con los datos falsificados que repite siempre.
					
					Ni siquiera existe el "trafico de personas" en nuestra sociedad humano-centrica donde todos son iguales y estan asegurados por la ley los verdaderos derechos democraticos, la libertad, la vida autentica y la dignidad del ser humano independiente.
					
					Si se cometiera la trata de humanos en las afueras del territorio de la RPDC, eso seria un producto del complot politico de las fuerzas hostiles del Sur de Corea y Japon que para ganar una suma miserable que les tira Estados Unidos segun la "ley de DDHH del Norte de Corea", deambulan por las fronteras con la RPDC y disfrazan de "asilados politicos" a los que salieron ilegalmente del pais, o los venden. 
					
					El trafico de personas es un mal de la sociedad capitalista donde la dignidad y el valor del ser humano se miden con el dinero y el hombre es una mercancia.
					
					Todos conocen que en EE.UU. se reporta la mayoria de los casos del trafico de seres humanos que ocurren en el mundo.
					
					Es absurdo que EE.UU., peor violador de derechos humanos que tiene ademas otros males sociales como la corrupcion, evaluara la situacion del "trafico de seres humanos" de alguien.
					
					Es una idea pueril disimular sus defectos criticando a otros. 
					
					Ademas, EE.UU. tiene el vicio de calumniar siniestramente a los paises, que no le obedecen, lo cual significa la aplicacion de su pauta de doble rasero y un complot politico.
					
					Cuestionar a la RPDC con el problema del trafico de seres humanos es la expresion representante de la politica hostil contra la RPDC y comprueba que nunca cambia la naturaleza hostil del imperio de aislar y aplastar el independiente regimen socialista optado por el pueblo coreano.
					
					Cuanto mas el imperio recurre a la anacronica politica hostil contra la RPDC, tanto mas esta no podra menos de hacer frente al respecto. En fin de cuentas, fortalecera mas y mas el disuasivo nuclear autodefensivo.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de participantes en acto de Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de participantes en acto de Congo
Pyongyang, 26 de junio (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un recibio un mensaje que le dirigieran el dia 13 los participantes en el acto del Congo Democratico por el 48o aniversario del inicio del trabajo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il en el Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					La misiva senala que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il fue el destacado politico reconocido por el mundo, afectuoso padre del pueblo y genial Comandante del Songun quien con la audacia incomparable y la destreza defendio la Corea socialista.
					
					Desde cuando el Dirigente emprendio su trabajo en el CC del PTC, esta organizacion politica se consolido aun mas a base de la idea revolucionaria del Presidente Kim Il Sung y se fortalecio incesantemente como partido masivo que goza de absoluto apoyo y confianza por parte de todo el pueblo, subraya.
					
					El Dirigente profundizo la inmortal idea Juche como la revolucionaria mas grande en la epoca de la independencia y dio a los pueblos progresistas del mundo un arma ideo-teorica, recuerda.
					
					Recalca que con la original politica del Songun, frustro las maniobras de los imperialistas encaminadas a  aplastar a la RPDC y la convirtio en una potencia ideo-politica y militar que envidia  todo el mundo.
					
					Se refiere a que sus imborrables hazanas realizadas ante la revolucion coreana y la causa de la independencia en el mundo, quedaran para siempre en el alma del pueblo coreano y la humanidad progresista del mundo.
					
					La misiva expresa la confianza de que el pueblo coreano, unido compactamente en torno al Maximo Dirigente, pondra de pleno manifiesto la inteligencia y el poderio de la nacion de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en la lucha por construir Estado prospero socialista.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim dirige diversas ramas de provincia de Hamgyong de Norte
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim dirige diversas ramas de provincia de Hamgyong de Norte
Pyongyang, 26 de junio (ACNC) -- Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y primer ministro de Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, hizo conocimiento en el terreno de las labores de la rama de la industria metalurgica de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					Recorrio varios puntos del Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek y la Aceria de Chongjin que libran dinamicamente la produccion de materiales de acero laminados y la innovacion tecnologica y reconocio concretamente el estado, la perspectiva y la modernizacion de la produccion.
					
					Tuvo lugar la reunion consultiva conjunta de los funcionarios del Consejo de Ministros y la rama de la industria metalurgica de la provincia.
					
					En la ocasion, se debatieron los temas de medida para expandir los exitos productivos logrados en el Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek, el Complejo de Minas de Musan, la Aceria de Chongjin y la Fabrica de Hierro de Aleacion de Puryong y producir por su propia cuenta los equipos pedidos necesarios al desarrollo de la industria metalurgica.
					
					Ademas, se refirio a los asuntos de realizar las labores economicas partiendo de los intereses del partido, la revolucion y el pueblo y de organizar bien la produccion, la direccion y el aseguramiento de materiales  en las fabricas de la rama.
					
					El premier, tras destacar la importancia del deber del dominio en la materializacion del legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el proposito del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un de construir una potencia economica, realizo la labor organizativa  economica.
					
					Por otra parte, el estuvo en el campo de construccion de la central hidroelectrica Orangchon y tomo las medidas para adelantar la construccion del dique Phalhyang y la inauguracion de la central hidroelectrica no.2.

articles.title: ACNC comenta la pasada guerra coreana
articles.content:
ACNC comenta la pasada guerra coreana
Pyongyang, 26 de junio (ACNC) -- ?Como se desato la guerra coreana (25 de junio de 1950-27 de julio de 1953) de la decada de 1950?
					El 26 de junio de 1950, MacArthur remitio un mensaje al premier japones Yoshida, en la cual le ordeno suspender durante los 30 dias desde el dia 27 de junio el Akahata, organo del Partido Comunista de Japon.
					
					El entonces periodico transmitio que "MacArthur hizo suspender temporalmente el organo Akahata porque este periodico transmitio el hecho de que el ejercito titere de Syngman Rhee agredio ilegalmente a  la zona de la parte norte del paralelo 38 de Corea".
					
					Esto no es mas que un minimo ejemplo del intento del imperialismo yanqui, caudillo de la provocacion de la guerra coreana, de ocultar su naturaleza.
					
					Al estallarse la guerra coreana, la situacion politica internacional y la formacion de las fuerzas en las relaciones internacionales se hallaban en la condicion muy desfavorable en realizar la estrategia de dominio al mundo de Estados Unidos.
					
					Despues del fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, quedo proclamada la Republica Popular China, se concerto la alianza amistosa URSS-China, se aumentaron y se desarrollaron notablemente la lucha por la liberacion nacional y las fuerzas democratas en Corea, Vietnam y todas las regiones asiaticas. Tambien la capa en el poder norteamericana se entrego a imputar uno a otro la responsabilidad del fracaso sobre el Extremo Oriente.
					
					Se amplio incesantemente en la palestra internacional la influencia de la esfera socialista y se puso en gran auge la lucha antiimperialista por la liberacion nacional en numerosos paises sometidos a la dominacion y la subyugacion de los imperialistas.
					
					Por otra parte, los complejos de industria militar de Estados Unidos y la situacion financiera de Wall Street necesitaban apremiantemente la guerra de  agresion.
					
					La economia estadounidense, que acogio la era dorada al adquirir los fabulosos provechos mediante la produccion y la venta de gran cantidad de pertrechos belicos durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial, inicio a sufrir poco a poco la depresion economica desde 1946.
					
					Se inicio la expansion de gastos militar sin precedente en la historia de EE.UU, y el pavor extrema de la crisis economica, los cuales obligaron a las autoridades politico-militares del imperio decidirse a desatar la guerra coreana como remedio para superarlos.
					
					La revista britanica Economist revelo que "Estados Unidos necesitaba la oportunidad para superar la crisis, razon por la cual no podia menos de fabricar la guerra".
					
					La opcion del imperio de superar con la guerra coreana la crisis economica incito el renacimiento de Japon.
					
					En el articulo "Politica de Estados Unidos para colonizar a Japon" insertado en entonces periodico Izbestiya, el Prof. Constantin Popov senalo:
					
					"Desde el punto de vista militar, Estados Unidos fomenta el desarrollo de la industria japonesa que se aprovechara facilmente para armar al ejercito japones en reconstruccion actualmente por la comandancia de MacArthur. Esta politica de las ocupantes autoridades estadounidenses parte de la politica de la capa norteamericana en el poder tendente a convertir a Japon en su trampolin militar en el Extremo Oriente. Hasta los principios de 1950, el valor total de la inversion de EE.UU. en Japon llego a 2 mil 500 millones de USD. Los provocadores de guerra estadounidenses planean aprovechar Japon como su trampolin militar-estrategico en el Extremo Oriente y la capa gobernante japonesa intenta utilizar la guerra coreana en realizar sus planes de venganza".
					
					EE.UU. desencadeno la guerra coreana por el temor ante el cada dia mas creciente poderio politico, economico y militar de la parte Norte de la Republica.
					
					5 dias antes del estallido de la guerra coreana preparada por EE.UU., el reportero del periodico Neue Zurcher Zeitung de Suiza transmitio la siguiente informacion procedente del Extremo Oriente:
					
					"Desde el punto de vista economico el Sur de Corea se halla en el estado dificil porque casi todas las empresas industriales y las centrales electricas principales que adquieren el ingreso, estan situadas en la parte Norte de Corea. La banda de Syngman Rhee busca en la ocupacion del Norte de Corea la salida de la situacion catastrofica", "En el Sur de Corea hay mucha gente que busca resolver el dificil problema economico en la agresion miliar al Norte de Corea. El ejercito de cien mil militares y la policia de 50 mil adiestrados bien por los norteamericanos superaran al ejercito del Norte de Corea".
					
					En cuanto a una foto tomada en el Sur de Corea por el reportero de AP, Yukorolkov, reportero de TASS en Berlin transmitio como sigue:
					
					El reportero norteamericano saco en el paralelo 38 una foto que demuestra la primera etapa de la agresion al Norte de Corea.
					
					En la foto se ve claramente el aspecto de John Foster Dulles, uno de los traficantes de guerra y asesor del secretario de Estado norteamericano, quien con la cara sobre la trinchera observaba bien el estado de inminente accion de combate.
					
					Dulles rodeado por el oficial norteamericano y los soldados de la tropa mercenaria de Syngman Rhee, verificaba personalmente el ejercito surcoreano dispuesto a combatir.
					
					El 28 de junio de 1950, Zhou Enlai, entonces premier del Gobierno Popular Central y ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular China, hizo publica una nota con respecto a la declaracion de Truman, fechada 27 de junio, sobre la intervencion agresiva en Corea.
					
					La declaracion de Truman expuso de modo abierto su plan militar y al mismo tiempo, lo puso en practica, subrayo la nota.
					
					Efectivamente, el ataque contra la RPDC, lanzado por el gobierno titere de Syngman Rhee a instigacion del gobierno de EE.UU., lo inicio este para procurar el pretexto de la agresion a Taiwan, Corea, Vietnam y otros, revelo.
					
					Esto es precisamente otro acto de intervencion del imperialismo norteamericano en los asuntos de Asia, preciso.
					
					Segun el reporte de TASS difundido el 29 de junio de 1950 desde Nueva York, un representante del Partido del Trabajo de EE.UU. dijo asi en la Camara de Representantes: "estamos en combate innecesario con el gobierno norcoreano".
					
					Vaticino que tal conducta de Truman "dara un resultado tragico al pueblo norteamericano".
					
					Los susodichos hechos historicos comprueban que EE.UU. no puede eludir nunca la responsabilidad del estallido de la pasada guerra coreana.

articles.title: Minju Joson comenta desfile de militaristas japoneses
articles.content:
Minju Joson comenta desfile de militaristas japoneses
Pyongyang, 26 de junio (ACNC) -- El dia 12, mas de 10 uniformados de las "Fuerzas Terrestres de Autodefensa", con caras pintadas de camuflaje y equipados con mochila militar, rifles automaticos y bayonetas, marcharon por las avenidas de los distritos de Itabashi y Nerima de Tokio.
					En un comentario individual publicado este martes, el periodico Minju Joson opina que ese suceso insolito, que hace recordar los tiempos previos a la guerra, comprueba el renacimiento del militarismo en Japon, y prosigue:
					
					Hasta la fecha, el militarismo de Japon estuvo disfrazado detras de las consignas de "paz" y "seguridad". Pero, hoy en dia, Japon lo promueve abiertamente sin ningun tapujo.
					
					Al restituir los derechos que tenian antes de la derrota en la Segunda Guerra Mundial como el de participar en la guerra y combate y el de contar con fuerzas armadas regulares, los reaccionarios japoneses quieren realizar su anejada ambicion politica de conformar la "esfera de coprosperidad de gran Asia Oriental".
					
					En ese contexto, ellos vienen impulsando la transformacion del pais en potencia militar y el renacimiento del militarismo enganando a la sociedad internacional.
					
					Puesto que ultimaron los preparativos para emerger como Estado de guerra, lo que hace falta ahora es eliminar las barreras institucionales y sociales que impedian el expansionismo militar a ultramar, he aqui la intencion de reaccionarios japoneses.
					
					Hoy marcharon mas de 10 uniformados nada mas por la parte centrica de Tokyo, pero manana retumbaran esta metropoli las botas de millones de tropas agresoras.
					
					Si los reaccionarios japoneses retoman por fin el camino de agresion desoyendo la demanda de la sociedad internacional y la opinion publica en contra de militarizacion, volveran a confirmar la leccion de historia de que los agresores se arruinan en las guerras desatadas por si mismos.
